column4: if someone could help me, that'd be great, my sound doesn't work.
no, when I go to a webpage that has videos, I cannot hear anything.
do I do that in terminal?
what i got from that was : 6736 ?     S    0:00 /usr/bin/esd -nobeebs
good. now, your media player is most likely using oss to try to get to the sound card (which esd has stolen)
which plugin are you using to view movies mplayer?
any other advice you could give me?
Ok. the crux of the matter is that flash needs exclusive access to your sound card. esd already has exclusive access. neither like sharing
either you can turn off esd (you'll lose ubuntu gnome sounds) and restart mozilla, or I can go into an extremely involved process of getting alsa dmix working
I believe the problem stems from a holdover from debian. Dunno why everything hasn't been switched to use alsa or the aoss wrapper by default.
